trans-unit.source: Processing Failures

seg-source.mrk: Processing Failures

trans-unit.source: Failures are processed based on the following parameters:

seg-source.mrk: Failures are processed based on the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: Periods within the invoicing period are regarded as negative lines (credit lines) on the invoice.

seg-source.mrk: Periods within the invoicing period are regarded as negative lines (credit lines) on the invoice.

trans-unit.source: Periods before the current invoicing period are regarded in a separate Credit Memo.

seg-source.mrk: Periods before the current invoicing period are regarded in a separate Credit Memo.

trans-unit.source: Periods after the current invoicing period are regarded as negative lines (credit lines) on the invoice in the proper period.

seg-source.mrk: Periods after the current invoicing period are regarded as negative lines (credit lines) on the invoice in the proper period.

trans-unit.source: These scenarios are demonstrated in the following sections.

seg-source.mrk: These scenarios are demonstrated in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Exercise – Failure Period within the Invoicing Period

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Failure Period within the Invoicing Period

trans-unit.source: Customer R-30000 orders four units of item R-30000-01 for the period of January 1, 2019 through March 3, 2019 at a price of 350.00 each. This is a monthly invoicing agreement; however the customer has asked to be invoiced for January and February immediately.

seg-source.mrk: Customer R-30000 orders four units of item R-30000-01 for the period of January 1, 2019 through March 3, 2019 at a price of 350.00 each.
This is a monthly invoicing agreement; however the customer has asked to be invoiced for January and February immediately.

trans-unit.source: At the beginning of March, the customer calls to say that one of the units is damaged. They want to return it and not be billed for it for the month of March.

seg-source.mrk: At the beginning of March, the customer calls to say that one of the units is damaged.
They want to return it and not be billed for it for the month of March.

trans-unit.source: Create, Ship and Invoice the Rent Order

seg-source.mrk: Create, Ship and Invoice the Rent Order

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create the rent order:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to create the rent order:

trans-unit.source: Set the Work Date to 01/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: Set the Work Date to 01/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click cc|rental > Contract Management > Rent Orders.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, click cc|rental > Contract Management > Rent Orders.

trans-unit.source: Insert a new rent order for customer R-30000.

seg-source.mrk: Insert a new rent order for customer R-30000.

trans-unit.source:
On the first line, enter the following:
  1. Type = Item
  2. No. = R-30000-01
  3. Quantity = 4
  4. Rental Rate Code = Month
  5. Month Based = Yes
  6. Rental Start Date = 01/01/19
  7. Rental End Date = 03/31/19

seg-source.mrk: On the first line, enter the following:<ol start="1">
• Type = Item
<li class="ccTextvorlageNumberedList">No.
• Quantity = 4
• Rental Rate Code = Month
• Month Based = Yes
• Rental Start Date = 01/01/19
• Rental End Date = 03/31/19

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post.

trans-unit.source: With the Ship option selected, click OK.

seg-source.mrk: With the Ship option selected, click OK.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post.

trans-unit.source: Select the Invoice option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Invoice option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 01/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 01/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 02/28/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 02/28/19.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

trans-unit.source: Open the invoice and then on the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

seg-source.mrk: Open the invoice and then on the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

trans-unit.source: Escape back to the rent order.

seg-source.mrk: Escape back to the rent order.

trans-unit.source: Create the Failure

seg-source.mrk: Create the Failure

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create the failure:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to create the failure:

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Enter Failure.

seg-source.mrk: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Enter Failure.

trans-unit.source: Click Yes to create the failure period.

seg-source.mrk: Click Yes to create the failure period.

trans-unit.source: In the Start Date Failure field, enter 03/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Start Date Failure field, enter 03/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the End Date Failure field, enter 03/31/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the End Date Failure field, enter 03/31/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Failure Type field, enter DAMAGE.

seg-source.mrk: In the Failure Type field, enter DAMAGE.

trans-unit.source: In the Quantity field, enter 1.

seg-source.mrk: In the Quantity field, enter 1.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Release.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Release.

trans-unit.source: : Released Rental Failure Card

seg-source.mrk: : Released Rental Failure Card

trans-unit.source: Click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: Click the value in the Qty. Failures field and review the failure information.

seg-source.mrk: Click the value in the <span class="Bold">Qty.
Failures field and review the failure information.

trans-unit.source: : Failure assigned to the rental line

seg-source.mrk: : Failure assigned to the rental line

trans-unit.source: Escape back to the rent order.

seg-source.mrk: Escape back to the rent order.

trans-unit.source: Process the Invoice with the Failure

seg-source.mrk: Process the Invoice with the Failure

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to process the invoice with the failure:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to process the invoice with the failure:

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

trans-unit.source: Select the Invoice option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Invoice option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 03/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 03/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 03/31/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 03/31/19.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

trans-unit.source:
Open the invoice and notice the following:
  • A negative credit line for the failed unit from 03/01/19 – 03/31/19 appears on the invoice.
  • The credit is correctly calculated for the damaged unit (350 rate unit price for the month of March).

seg-source.mrk: Open the invoice and notice the following:
<li class="ccTextvorlageNumberedList">A negative credit line for the failed unit from 03/01/19 – 03/31/19 appears on the invoice.
• The credit is correctly calculated for the damaged unit (350 rate unit price for the month of March).

seg-source.mrk: : Failure assigned to the rental line

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

trans-unit.source: Escape back to the Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: Escape back to the Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: On the Navigate tab, click Entries > Rental Ledger Entries.

seg-source.mrk: On the Navigate tab, click Entries > Rental Ledger Entries.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the credit line appears for the proper amount, in the proper date range, and for the proper quantity.

seg-source.mrk: Notice that the credit line appears for the proper amount, in the proper date range, and for the proper quantity.

seg-source.mrk: Click the value in the <span class="Bold">Qty.
Failures field.

trans-unit.source: In the Rental Failures page, notice that the failure invoice was created through 03/31/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Rental Failures page, notice that the failure invoice was created through 03/31/19.

seg-source.mrk: : Updated rental failure line

seg-source.mrk: Process the Return

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to process the return:

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 03/05/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 03/05/19.

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab, enter 03/05/19 in the Rental Return Date field.

seg-source.mrk: On the Lines FastTab, enter 03/05/19 in the Rental Return Date field.

trans-unit.source: In the Return Qty. to Receive field, type 1.

seg-source.mrk: In the <span class="Bold">Return Qty.
to Receive field, type 1.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

trans-unit.source: Select the Receive option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Receive option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the Return Qty. Received and Quantity Invoiced fields are 1.

seg-source.mrk: Notice that the <span class="Bold">Return Qty.
Received and Quantity Invoiced fields are 1.

trans-unit.source: Process the return of the remaining three items on 03/31/19.

seg-source.mrk: Process the return of the remaining three items on 03/31/19.

trans-unit.source: Exercise – Failure Period before the Invoicing Period

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Failure Period before the Invoicing Period

trans-unit.source: Customer R-30000 orders five units of item R-30000-01 for the period of January 1, 2019 through March 31, 2019 at a price of 350 each. This is a monthly invoicing agreement and the January invoice is posted immediately.

seg-source.mrk: Customer R-30000 orders five units of item R-30000-01 for the period of January 1, 2019 through March 31, 2019 at a price of 350 each.
This is a monthly invoicing agreement and the January invoice is posted immediately.

trans-unit.source: In mid-January, the customer calls to say that two of the units are damaged. You assure them that the items can be fixed at no cost for the down period of January 15th through January 20th and tell them that they will receive a credit memo with the next invoice billing.

seg-source.mrk: In mid-January, the customer calls to say that two of the units are damaged.
You assure them that the items can be fixed at no cost for the down period of January 15th through January 20th and tell them that they will receive a credit memo with the next invoice billing.

trans-unit.source: Exercise – Failure Period after the Invoicing Period

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Failure Period after the Invoicing Period

trans-unit.source: Customer R-30000 orders five units of item R-30000-01 for the period of January 1, 2019 through March 31, 2019 at a price of 350 each. This is a monthly invoicing agreement and January will be posted immediately.

seg-source.mrk: Customer R-30000 orders five units of item R-30000-01 for the period of January 1, 2019 through March 31, 2019 at a price of 350 each.
This is a monthly invoicing agreement and January will be posted immediately.

trans-unit.source: Before other invoicing occurs, you notify the customer that an inspection is required on two items which may cause some downtime from March 1st through March 5th so you will credit 70% of the price for this time on the March invoice. The customer agrees to this arrangement and you create the failure.

seg-source.mrk: Before other invoicing occurs, you notify the customer that an inspection is required on two items which may cause some downtime from March 1st through March 5th so you will credit 70% of the price for this time on the March invoice.
The customer agrees to this arrangement and you create the failure.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

trans-unit.source: Open the invoice and notice that no credit entries appear.

seg-source.mrk: Open the invoice and notice that no credit entries appear.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

trans-unit.source: Escape back to the rent order.

seg-source.mrk: Escape back to the rent order.

trans-unit.source: On the Navigate tab, click Credit Memos. Notice that no credit memos were created.

seg-source.mrk: On the Navigate tab, click Credit Memos.
Notice that no credit memos were created.

trans-unit.source: Escape back to the rent order.

seg-source.mrk: Escape back to the rent order.

trans-unit.source: Process the Final Invoice and Return

seg-source.mrk: Process the Final Invoice and Return

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to process the final invoice and complete the return:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to process the final invoice and complete the return:

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

trans-unit.source: Click the Invoice option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Click the Invoice option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 03/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 03/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 03/31/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 03/31/19.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

trans-unit.source:
Open the invoice and notice the following:
  • A negative credit line for the downtime on two units from 03/01/19 – 03/05/19 appear on the invoice.
  • The credit is correctly calculated for the two units (350 rate unit price / 31 * 5 days * 2 units - 70% = 79.03).

seg-source.mrk: Open the invoice and notice the following:
<li class="ccTextvorlageNumberedList">A negative credit line for the downtime on two units from 03/01/19 – 03/05/19 appear on the invoice.
• The credit is correctly calculated for the two units (350 rate unit price / 31 * 5 days * 2 units - 70% = 79.03).

trans-unit.source: : Failure assigned to the rental line

seg-source.mrk: : Failure assigned to the rental line

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

trans-unit.source: Escape back to the rent order.

seg-source.mrk: Escape back to the rent order.

trans-unit.source: Click the value in the Qty. Failures field and notice that the failure invoice was created through 3/5/2019.

seg-source.mrk: Click the value in the <span class="Bold">Qty.
Failures field and notice that the failure invoice was created through 3/5/2019.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 03/31/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 03/31/19.

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab, enter 03/31/19 in the Rental Return Date field.

seg-source.mrk: On the Lines FastTab, enter 03/31/19 in the Rental Return Date field.

trans-unit.source: In the Return Qty. to Receive field, enter 5.

seg-source.mrk: In the <span class="Bold">Return Qty.
to Receive field, enter 5.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

trans-unit.source: Select the Receive option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Receive option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the Return Qty. Received field is 5.
